protoping.h
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 /*H*************************************************************************************************/
2 /*!
3 
4  \File protoping.h
5 
6  \Description
7  This module implements a Dirtysock ping routine. It can both generate
8  ping requests and record their responses. Because ICMP access (ping)
9  is o/s specific, different code is used for each environment. This code
10  was derived from the Winsock version.
11 
12  \Notes
13  None.
14 
15  \Copyright
16  Copyright (c) Tiburon Entertainment / Electronic Arts 2002. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED.
17 
18  \Version 1.0 04/03/2002 (GWS) First Version
19  \Version 1.1 11/18/2002 (JLB) Names changed to include "Proto"
20 
21 */
22 /*************************************************************************************************H*/
23 
24 #ifndef _protoping_h
25 #define _protoping_h
26 
27 /*!
28 \Moduledef ProtoPing ProtoPing
29 \Modulemember Proto
30 */
31 //@{
32 
33 /*** Include files *********************************************************************/
34 
35 #include "DirtySDK/platform.h"
36 #include "DirtySDK/dirtysock/dirtyaddr.h"
37 
38 /*** Defines ***************************************************************************/
39 
40 /*
41  Summary of Message Types (RFC792)
42  0 Echo Reply
43  3 Destination Unreachable
44  4 Source Quench
45  5 Redirect
46  8 Echo
47  11 Time Exceeded
48  12 Parameter Problem
49  13 Timestamp
50  14 Timestamp Reply
51  15 Information Request
52  16 Information Reply
53 */
54 
55 // ICMP packet types we handle
56 #define ICMP_ECHOREPLY (0) //! ICMP echo reply
57 #define ICMP_DESTUNREACH (3) //! ICMP destination unreachable
58 #define ICMP_ECHOREQ (8) //! ICMP echo request
59 #define ICMP_TIMEEXCEEDED (11) //! ICMP time exceeded
60 
61 #define PROTOPING_MAXUSERDATA (256) //!< maximum user data size
62 
63 /*** Macros ****************************************************************************/
64 
65 /*** Type Definitions ******************************************************************/
66 
67 typedef enum PingType
68 {
69  PROTOPING_TYPE_ICMP = 0,
70  PROTOPING_TYPE_QOS,
71 
72  PROTOPING_NUMTYPES
73 } ePingType;
74 
75 // opaque module state reference
76 typedef struct ProtoPingRefT ProtoPingRefT;
77 
78 //! ping response structure
79 typedef struct ProtoPingResponseT
80 {
81  DirtyAddrT Addr; //!< address of host that replied (opaque form)
82  uint32_t uAddr; //!< address of host that replied (old form)
83  int16_t iPing; //!< ping response time, or -1 for timeout
84  uint16_t uSeqn; //!< sequence number
85  uint16_t uNumRetries; //!< number of retries before success (will be non-zero only on Xbox)
86  uint8_t uType; //!< ICMP type of response
87  uint8_t bServer; //!< TRUE if this was a server ping, else FALSE
88 } ProtoPingResponseT;

98 // create new module

100 
101 // destroy the module
102 DIRTYCODE_API void ProtoPingDestroy(ProtoPingRefT *pProtoPing);
103 
104 // change a ping state value
105 DIRTYCODE_API int32_t ProtoPingControl(ProtoPingRefT *pProtoPing, int32_t iControl, int32_t iValue, void *pValue);
106 
107 // send a ping request
108 DIRTYCODE_API int32_t ProtoPingRequest(ProtoPingRefT *pProtoPing, DirtyAddrT *pAddr, const unsigned char *pData, int32_t iDataLen, int32_t iTimeout, int32_t iTtl);
109 
110 // ping server
111 DIRTYCODE_API int32_t ProtoPingRequestServer(ProtoPingRefT *pProtoPing, uint32_t uServerAddress, const unsigned char *pData, int32_t iDataLen, int32_t iTimeout, int32_t iTtl);
112 
113 // get latest ping response
114 DIRTYCODE_API int32_t ProtoPingResponse(ProtoPingRefT *pProtoPing, unsigned char *pBuffer, int32_t *pBufLen, ProtoPingResponseT *pResponse);
115 
116 #ifdef __cplusplus
117 }
118 #endif
